segment.source: Bootsect Command-Line Options
segment.target: Bootsect Command-Line Options

segment.source: Bootsect Command-Line Options
segment.target: Bootsect Command-Line Options

segment.source: Bootsect Command-Line Options
segment.target: Bootsect Command-Line Options

segment.source: Bootsect.exe updates the master boot code for hard disk partitions to switch between Bootmgr and NT Loader (NTLDR).
segment.target: Bootsect.exe updates the master boot code for hard disk partitions to switch between Bootmgr and NT Loader (NTLDR).

segment.source: You can use this tool to restore the boot sector on your computer.
segment.target: You can use this tool to restore the boot sector on your computer.

segment.source: This tool replaces FixFAT and FixNTFS.
segment.target: This tool replaces FixFAT and FixNTFS.

segment.source: Bootsect Commands
segment.target: Bootsect Commands

segment.source: Bootsect uses the following command-line options:
segment.target: Bootsect uses the following command-line options:

segment.source: bootsect {/help | /nt52 | /nt60} {SYS | ALL | DriveLetter:} /force /mbr
segment.target: bootsect {/help | /nt52 | /nt60} {SYS | ALL | DriveLetter:} /force /mbr

segment.source: For example, to apply the master boot code that is compatible with NTLDR to the volume labeled E, use the following command:
segment.target: For example, to apply the master boot code that is compatible with NTLDR to the volume labeled E, use the following command:

segment.source: bootsect /nt52 E:
segment.target: bootsect /nt52 E:

segment.source: Command-line options
segment.target: Command-line options

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /help
segment.target: /help

segment.source: Displays these usage instructions.
segment.target: Displays these usage instructions.

segment.source: /nt52
segment.target: /nt52

segment.source: Applies the master boot code that is compatible with NTLDR to SYS, ALL, or DriveLetter.
segment.target: Applies the master boot code that is compatible with NTLDR to SYS, ALL, or DriveLetter.

segment.source: The operating system installed on SYS, ALL, or DriveLetter must be older than Windows Vista.
segment.target: The operating system installed on SYS, ALL, or DriveLetter must be older than Windows Vista.

segment.source: /nt60
segment.target: /nt60

segment.source: Applies the master boot code that is compatible with Bootmgr to SYS, ALL, or DriveLetter.
segment.target: Applies the master boot code that is compatible with Bootmgr to SYS, ALL, or DriveLetter.

segment.source: The operating system installed on SYS, ALL, or DriveLetter must be Windows 8, Windows® 7, Windows Vista, Windows Server® 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, or Windows Server 2008.
segment.target: The operating system installed on SYS, ALL, or DriveLetter must be Windows 8, Windows® 7, Windows Vista, Windows Server® 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, or Windows Server 2008.

segment.source: SYS
segment.target: SYS

segment.source: Updates the master boot code on the system partition that is used to boot Windows.
segment.target: Updates the master boot code on the system partition that is used to boot Windows.

segment.source: ALL
segment.target: ALL

segment.source: Updates the master boot code on all partitions.
segment.target: Updates the master boot code on all partitions.

segment.source: The ALL option does not necessarily update the boot code for each volume.
segment.target: The ALL option does not necessarily update the boot code for each volume.

segment.source: Instead, this option updates the boot code on volumes that can be used as Windows boot volumes, which excludes any dynamic volumes that are not connected with an underlying disk partition.
segment.target: Instead, this option updates the boot code on volumes that can be used as Windows boot volumes, which excludes any dynamic volumes that are not connected with an underlying disk partition.

segment.source: This restriction is present because boot code must be located at the beginning of a disk partition.
segment.target: This restriction is present because boot code must be located at the beginning of a disk partition.

segment.source: DriveLetter
segment.target: DriveLetter

segment.source: Updates the master boot code on the volume associated with this drive letter.
segment.target: Updates the master boot code on the volume associated with this drive letter.

segment.source: Boot code will not be updated if either:
segment.target: Boot code will not be updated if either:

segment.source: DriveLetter is not associated with a volume
segment.target: DriveLetter is not associated with a volume

segment.source: DriveLetter is associated with a volume not connected to an underlying disk partition.
segment.target: DriveLetter is associated with a volume not connected to an underlying disk partition.

segment.source: /force
segment.target: /force

segment.source: Forcibly dismounts the volumes during the boot code update.
segment.target: Forcibly dismounts the volumes during the boot code update.

segment.source: You must use this option with caution.
segment.target: You must use this option with caution.

segment.source: If Bootsect.exe cannot gain exclusive volume access, then the file system may overwrite the boot code before the next reboot.
segment.target: If Bootsect.exe cannot gain exclusive volume access, then the file system may overwrite the boot code before the next reboot.

segment.source: Bootsect.exe always attempts to lock and dismount the volume before each update.
segment.target: Bootsect.exe always attempts to lock and dismount the volume before each update.

segment.source: When /force is specified, a forced dismount is tried if the initial lock attempt fails.
segment.target: When /force is specified, a forced dismount is tried if the initial lock attempt fails.

segment.source: A lock can fail, for example, if files on the destination volume are currently opened by other programs.
segment.target: A lock can fail, for example, if files on the destination volume are currently opened by other programs.

segment.source: When successful, a forced dismount enables exclusive volume access and a reliable boot code update even though the initial lock failed.
segment.target: When successful, a forced dismount enables exclusive volume access and a reliable boot code update even though the initial lock failed.

segment.source: At the same time, a forced dismount invalidates all open handles to files on the destination volume.
segment.target: At the same time, a forced dismount invalidates all open handles to files on the destination volume.

segment.source: This can cause unexpected behavior from the programs that opened these files.
segment.target: This can cause unexpected behavior from the programs that opened these files.

segment.source: Therefore, use this option with caution.
segment.target: Therefore, use this option with caution.

segment.source: /mbr
segment.target: /mbr

segment.source: Updates the master boot record without changing the partition table on sector 0 of the disk that contains the partition specified by SYS, ALL, or drive letter.
segment.target: Updates the master boot record without changing the partition table on sector 0 of the disk that contains the partition specified by SYS, ALL, or drive letter.

segment.source: When used with the /nt52 option, the master boot record is compatible with operating systems older than Windows Vista.
segment.target: When used with the /nt52 option, the master boot record is compatible with operating systems older than Windows Vista.

segment.source: When used with the /nt60 option, the master boot record is compatible with Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, or Windows Server 2008.
segment.target: When used with the /nt60 option, the master boot record is compatible with Windows 8, Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, or Windows Server 2008.

segment.target: Related topics
